Stem: Married people report higher levels of happiness, on average, than unmarried people. Give one reason why this might be true, other than marriage causing happiness.

Aliases: happy people more likely to marry

RunsThroughA.text: Marriage provides companionship and emotional support, which makes people happier.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->B. Companionship/support is the mechanism by which marriage causes happiness.

RunsThroughA.text: Married couples share expenses, so they have less financial stress, leading to more happiness.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->Mediator->B. Shared expenses/economies of scale (Mediator) are a direct consequence of being married (A).

RunsThroughA.text: Being married reduces loneliness, and loneliness causes unhappiness.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->Displacement->B. Marriage (A) displaces loneliness, leading to happiness (B).

RunsThroughA.text: Married people have a partner to help them through tough times, which increases happiness.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->B. Having a partner is the mechanism by which marriage causes happiness.

Good.text: People who are already happier and more emotionally stable are more likely to attract a partner and get married.
